Tampa Bay Buccaneers: Baker Mayfield (QB) is dealing with a sprained left shoulder suffered in Week 12. He’s officially questionable and may be limited in his ability to scramble if he plays [oai_citation:0‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=Why%20Ali%20picked%20the%20Cardinals%3A,from%20the%20Bucs%27%20defense%2C%20but). The Buccaneers’ defense is also shorthanded, with edge rusher Haason Reddick (ankle) and starting CB Jamel Dean (groin) ruled out [oai_citation:1‡si.com](https://www.si.com/betting/cardinals-vs-buccaneers-prediction-odds-spread-injuries-trends-for-nfl-week-13#:~:text=,Benjamin%20Morrison%20%E2%80%93%20out), weakening both the pass rush and secondary [oai_citation:2‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=could%20potentially%20be%20mitigated%20by,At%20some%20point%2C%20Arizona).
Arizona Cardinals: Kyler Murray (QB) remains on injured reserve (knee) and hasn’t played all season. Veteran Jacoby Brissett continues to start in Murray’s place, providing steady but unspectacular play [oai_citation:3‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=points,from%20the%20Bucs%27%20defense%2C%20but). Rookie WR Marvin Harrison Jr. (knee) was lost for the season, removing a potential big-play weapon from Arizona’s offense [oai_citation:4‡si.com](https://www.si.com/betting/cardinals-vs-buccaneers-prediction-odds-spread-injuries-trends-for-nfl-week-13#:~:text=Cardinals%20Injury%20Report).

expert_picks.name: Ali Bhanpuri
expert_picks.commentary: “Tampa has been in a bad way since the bye, losing three straight by increasingly ugly margins. And now Baker Mayfield’s banged-up shoulder puts them at even more of a disadvantage. The Cards have lost eight of nine themselves, but at some point Arizona has to find itself on the right side of a one-score game – why not against a banged-up Tampa team?” [oai_citation:5‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=Why%20Ali%20picked%20the%20Cardinals%3A,from%20the%20Bucs%27%20defense%2C%20but) [oai_citation:6‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=stadium%2C%20these%20shortcomings%20would%20unquestionably,up%20Tampa%20team)

weather: No significant weather concerns are noted for this game (conditions expected to be normal).
market_context: Tampa Bay opened as a 3.5-point favorite, but the line has tightened to -3 [oai_citation:7‡thepunterspage.com](https://www.thepunterspage.com/news/nfl/nfl-week-13-sharp-money-and-public-betting-report/#:~:text=Cardinals%20%40%20Buccaneers%20ARI%3A%2041). The slight move toward Arizona suggests some money came in on the underdog. Betting action is fairly split, with no clear public vs. sharp divergence noted for this matchup [oai_citation:8‡thepunterspage.com](https://www.thepunterspage.com/news/nfl/nfl-week-13-sharp-money-and-public-betting-report/#:~:text=Cardinals%20%40%20Buccaneers%20ARI%3A%2041).
matchup_breakdown: The Buccaneers’ pass defense has struggled mightily of late – they’ve allowed the most TD passes in the NFL over the last three weeks [oai_citation:9‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=could%20potentially%20be%20mitigated%20by,At%20some%20point%2C%20Arizona), and their injury-depleted secondary could be vulnerable. Arizona’s offense, however, has often failed to capitalize on opportunities, going 2-6 in one-possession games this year [oai_citation:10‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=stadium%2C%20these%20shortcomings%20would%20unquestionably,up%20Tampa%20team). The key battle will be whether Arizona can exploit Tampa’s coverage issues while avoiding the mistakes (they were +4 in turnovers last week and still lost) that have plagued them. If Tampa’s pass rush (missing Reddick) can’t pressure Brissett, the Cardinals may finally break through.

quarterback_outlook.Tampa Bay Buccaneers: Baker Mayfield’s toughness is unquestioned, but with a sore left shoulder his mobility and downfield throwing could be limited [oai_citation:11‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=points,from%20the%20Bucs%27%20defense%2C%20but). The Bucs may scheme up quicker, shorter passes to protect him. Mayfield has thrown 0 TDs and 2 INTs during the three-game losing streak and now faces potential pressure to perform despite the injury.
quarterback_outlook.Arizona Cardinals: Jacoby Brissett has been a stabilizing veteran presence in Kyler Murray’s absence. He isn’t making many explosive plays, but he generally takes care of the football. Last week, despite Brissett helping Arizona win the turnover battle (+4), the offense only produced 23 points in a loss [oai_citation:12‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=stadium%2C%20these%20shortcomings%20would%20unquestionably,up%20Tampa%20team). Brissett will look to manage the game and target Tampa’s vulnerable secondary.

coaching_and_strategy.Tampa Bay Buccaneers: Head coach Todd Bowles (a defensive specialist) has seen his defense falter recently, especially against the pass [oai_citation:13‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=could%20potentially%20be%20mitigated%20by,At%20some%20point%2C%20Arizona). With Mayfield banged up, Bowles and OC Dave Canales may opt for a run-heavy, conservative game plan and rely on defense – but that unit must improve communication in a depleted secondary. Bowles will emphasize avoiding the big mistakes that have cost Tampa in close games.
coaching_and_strategy.Arizona Cardinals: Rookie head coach Jonathan Gannon has endured a rough stretch (eight losses in nine games). He’s likely to stay aggressive on defense – despite injuries, Arizona’s defense forced 4 turnovers last week by being opportunistic [oai_citation:14‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=stadium%2C%20these%20shortcomings%20would%20unquestionably,up%20Tampa%20team). Offensively, OC Drew Petzing may try to simplify reads for Brissett and attack the backup corners on Tampa Bay. The Cardinals know they have nothing to lose, so Gannon could pull out a few trick plays or fourth-down gambles to steal a win.

miscellaneous: Arizona is an unlucky 2-6 in one-possession games this season, which suggests they’ve been more competitive than their record indicates [oai_citation:15‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=stadium%2C%20these%20shortcomings%20would%20unquestionably,up%20Tampa%20team).

Since their Week 9 bye, the Buccaneers have lost three straight games by 5, 12, and 27 points, respectively [oai_citation:16‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=Why%20Ali%20picked%20the%20Cardinals%3A,Mayfield%27s%20injury). They’ve been trending in the wrong direction as injuries mount.

This game is being played at Raymond James Stadium in Tampa, but both teams are on extended losing streaks and desperate to break the skid. It might come down to which side handles adversity (and injuries) better on Sunday.

Atlanta Falcons: Drake London (WR) is nursing a knee injury and was officially listed as doubtful mid-week [oai_citation:17‡teamrankings.com](https://www.teamrankings.com/nfl/matchup/falcons-jets-week-13-2025/injuries#:~:text=and%20it%20remains%20to%20be,is%20no%20timetable%20for%20return). London is the Falcons’ top receiver, so his likely absence would be a major blow to the passing game. All-Pro RG Chris Lindstrom (foot) was limited in practice [oai_citation:18‡teamrankings.com](https://www.teamrankings.com/nfl/matchup/falcons-jets-week-13-2025/injuries#:~:text=on%20November%2030th,is%20no%20timetable%20for%20recovery), though the team hopes he can play; Atlanta’s offensive line is already without RT Kaleb McGary, who was lost for the season earlier (leg injury). Rookie QB Michael Penix Jr. opened the year as the starter but landed on IR with a knee injury [oai_citation:19‡teamrankings.com](https://www.teamrankings.com/nfl/matchup/falcons-jets-week-13-2025/injuries#:~:text=reserve%20list%20with%20an%20achilles,projected%20to%20miss%20the%20remainder) – the Falcons have since turned to veteran Kirk Cousins under center [oai_citation:20‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=Why%20Gennaro%20picked%20the%20Jets%3A,So).

On defense, the Falcons placed CB Clark Phillips III (triceps) on IR and he remains out [oai_citation:21‡teamrankings.com](https://www.teamrankings.com/nfl/matchup/falcons-jets-week-13-2025/injuries#:~:text=list%20after%20he%20underwent%20ankle,injured%20reserve%20list%20with%20a). DE Zach Harrison (knee) and OL Matthew Bergeron (ankle) are among several depth players listed as questionable [oai_citation:22‡teamrankings.com](https://www.teamrankings.com/nfl/matchup/falcons-jets-week-13-2025/injuries#:~:text=Casey%20Washington%20WR%2011%2F23%20Back,the%20Jets%20on%20November%2030th) [oai_citation:23‡teamrankings.com](https://www.teamrankings.com/nfl/matchup/falcons-jets-week-13-2025/injuries#:~:text=Drake%20London%20WR%2011%2F23%20Knee,is%20no%20timetable%20for%20recovery). Atlanta’s roster has been hit hard by injuries, particularly on offense where multiple linemen and receivers are either out or less than 100%.
New York Jets: Sauce Gardner (CB) and Quinnen Williams (DT) – the Jets’ two best defenders – were both traded away at the deadline and are no longer with the team [oai_citation:24‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=which%20squad%20will%20break%20the,to%20squeak%20out%20a%20low). Their absence has severely weakened New York’s defense, which incredibly has only 1 takeaway all season (an NFL record low through 11 games) [oai_citation:25‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=but%20New%20York%20has%20surprisingly,wattage%20win%20at%20home). On offense, QB Aaron Rodgers is long gone (he was traded to Pittsburgh earlier this year), and the Jets are now starting veteran Tyrod Taylor at quarterback [oai_citation:26‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=Why%20Gennaro%20picked%20the%20Jets%3A,So) after cycling through options.

Garrett Wilson (WR) is dealing with a knee injury and was limited in practice (officially questionable) [oai_citation:27‡teamrankings.com](https://www.teamrankings.com/nfl/matchup/falcons-jets-week-13-2025/injuries#:~:text=injury%2C%20and%20it%20is%20uncertain,McDonald%20is%20dealing%20with%20a). If Wilson can’t play or is limited, an already struggling Jets offense would be without its top receiving threat. The Jets also have several linemen on the injury report – for example, OL Xavier Newman-Johnson (ankle) is questionable [oai_citation:28‡teamrankings.com](https://www.teamrankings.com/nfl/matchup/falcons-jets-week-13-2025/injuries#:~:text=Khalil%20Herbert%20RB%2011%2F23%20Groin,the%20Falcons%20on%20November%2030th). With the offense severely short-handed and the defense missing star power, New York’s depth will be tested.

expert_picks.name: Gennaro Filice
expert_picks.commentary: “Both teams are well out of the playoff picture, but I’ll take the upset with the Jets squeaking out a low-wattage win at home. Atlanta’s defense has been superior over the course of the season, but New York has surprisingly shown more life on that side of the ball after losing its two best defenders at the trade deadline. And Aaron Glenn’s D is due for some turnover luck – they have ONE takeaway all year, setting an ignominious NFL record. That’s about to change against an immobile quarterback with diminished arm strength. The Jets force two turnovers to squeak it out.” [oai_citation:29‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=which%20squad%20will%20break%20the,wattage%20win%20at%20home)

weather: No significant weather issues are noted for this game at MetLife Stadium. Conditions should be typical for a December game in New Jersey (cold but nothing unusual mentioned by experts).
market_context: Atlanta opened as roughly a 1.5-point favorite on the road, and that spread has grown to Falcons -2.5 as of mid-week [oai_citation:30‡thepunterspage.com](https://www.thepunterspage.com/news/nfl/nfl-week-13-sharp-money-and-public-betting-report/#:~:text=Current%3A%20MIA%20,Jets%20ATL%3A%2068%20%2F%2063). About 68% of bets and 63% of the money have come in on Atlanta, indicating public and possibly sharp support for the Falcons [oai_citation:31‡thepunterspage.com](https://www.thepunterspage.com/news/nfl/nfl-week-13-sharp-money-and-public-betting-report/#:~:text=Current%3A%20MIA%20,Jets%20ATL%3A%2068%20%2F%2063). There’s no notable reverse line movement, and the total is a low 39.5 reflecting expectations of a defensive, low-scoring game [oai_citation:32‡thepunterspage.com](https://www.thepunterspage.com/news/nfl/nfl-week-13-sharp-money-and-public-betting-report/#:~:text=Current%3A%20MIA%20,Jets%20ATL%3A%2068%20%2F%2063).
matchup_breakdown: This game features two struggling offenses. Atlanta’s offense is “perfectly mediocre” in recent weeks (middle of the pack in efficiency) [oai_citation:33‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=team%2C%20a%20perfectly%20mediocre%20group,to%20pull%20another%20one%20out), but the Jets’ offense has been even worse, averaging under 20 points per game on the year. The Jets do have an opportunistic defense despite the lack of takeaways – they are coming off a game where they held a team to 13 points. Key matchup: Atlanta’s run game (with Bijan Robinson and Tyler Allgeier) against a Jets front that has been surprisingly stout even after losing Quinnen Williams. Also, watch Atlanta’s pass protection – the Jets have virtually no pass rush production this season, but Falcons QB Kirk Cousins isn’t very mobile [oai_citation:34‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=the%20trade%20deadline,wattage%20win%20at%20home). Whichever unit (Falcons offense or Jets defense) can overcome its deficiencies will decide this game.

quarterback_outlook.Atlanta Falcons: Kirk Cousins took over as Atlanta’s quarterback mid-season. At 37 years old, he’s past his prime and essentially serving as a veteran stopgap on a lost season [oai_citation:35‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=eliminated%20Buffalo%20from%20playoff%20contention,side%20of%20the%20ball%20after). Cousins still throws an accurate ball when given time, but he’s immobile and playing behind a decimated O-line. He’s facing a Jets defense that, incredibly, has zero interceptions on the season [oai_citation:36‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=the%20trade%20deadline,wattage%20win%20at%20home) – if Cousins can avoid being the first to give them one, the Falcons should move the ball enough to win.
quarterback_outlook.New York Jets: Tyrod Taylor is starting for New York – a decade after he first became a full-time starter in 2015 [oai_citation:37‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=Why%20Gennaro%20picked%20the%20Jets%3A,So). Taylor is a savvy veteran who can use his legs, but at 36 his physical skills have waned. The Jets’ passing offense has been anemic (they’ve scored under 15 points in three straight games). Taylor’s primary task will be protecting the football. With top target Garrett Wilson banged up, Taylor may lean on short throws to RBs and TEs and hope to generate offense through scrambles or broken plays.

coaching_and_strategy.Atlanta Falcons: Interim head coach Raheem Morris (promoted after Arthur Smith’s firing) is trying to inject life into the Falcons. Morris has emphasized fundamentals and actually has the defense playing decent football despite the record. Offensively, Atlanta’s play-calling under OC Dave Ragone has been conservative – expect a run-heavy script with some play-action for Cousins. Morris might also dial up a few blitzes on defense, knowing the Jets have a backup QB and a shaky offensive line.
coaching_and_strategy.New York Jets: Jets head coach Robert Saleh was let go earlier in the year, and new head coach Aaron Glenn (formerly the DC) is now at the helm. Glenn has his defense playing hard; they’ve been unlucky in turnovers but still keep games close [oai_citation:38‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=the%20trade%20deadline,wattage%20win%20at%20home). Offensively, the Jets brought in an experienced play-caller (possibly a senior offensive assistant) after firing their OC mid-season – so far it hasn’t yielded results. Look for the Jets to try some gadget plays or hurry-up offense to spark Tyrod Taylor and put the Falcons on their heels. Glenn’s overall strategy will be to turn this into a grinding, ugly game and hope the Jets steal it with a big special teams play or turnover.

miscellaneous: This game is a reunion of sorts: Falcons QB Kirk Cousins and Jets QB Tyrod Taylor last faced off as starters back in 2015, when Cousins was with Washington and Taylor with Buffalo [oai_citation:39‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=Why%20Gennaro%20picked%20the%20Jets%3A,So). A decade later, they meet again in very different circumstances.

The Jets have forced just one turnover in 11 games, setting an NFL record for futility in that category [oai_citation:40‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=the%20trade%20deadline,wattage%20win%20at%20home). That sole takeaway was a fumble recovery – they have zero interceptions. It’s an almost unimaginable drought that both teams are aware of.

Atlanta’s defense ranks a respectable 12th in EPA/play since Week 8 [oai_citation:41‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=in%20EPA%20per%20play%20on,to%20pull%20another%20one%20out), actually similar to Miami’s in that span. The Jets’ defense, even minus its stars, has held opponents under 20 points in back-to-back weeks. So, despite the teams’ poor records, this could be a defensive slugfest.

Cincinnati Bengals: Joe Burrow (QB) is making his return after missing four games with a severe turf toe injury that required surgery [oai_citation:42‡baltimorebeatdown.com](https://www.baltimorebeatdown.com/baltimore-ravens-injuries/78122/baltimore-ravens-cincinnati-bengals-week-13-injury-report-joe-burrow-to-play#:~:text=The%20Bengals%20officially%20activated%20quarterback,turf%20toe%20that%20required%20surgery). The Bengals officially activated Burrow from IR, and he’s set to start on Thanksgiving night with no injury designation [oai_citation:43‡baltimorebeatdown.com](https://www.baltimorebeatdown.com/baltimore-ravens-injuries/78122/baltimore-ravens-cincinnati-bengals-week-13-injury-report-joe-burrow-to-play#:~:text=The%20Bengals%20officially%20activated%20quarterback,turf%20toe%20that%20required%20surgery). His return is a massive boost. However, Burrow’s supporting cast is not at full strength: WR Tee Higgins is out due to a concussion suffered earlier in the week [oai_citation:44‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=back,edge%20to%20the%20home%20team) [oai_citation:45‡baltimorebeatdown.com](https://www.baltimorebeatdown.com/baltimore-ravens-injuries/78122/baltimore-ravens-cincinnati-bengals-week-13-injury-report-joe-burrow-to-play#:~:text=Out). Higgins is the Bengals’ No. 2 receiver, so his absence will be felt (especially as Ja’Marr Chase just came off a suspension).

On defense, Cincinnati will be without DE Trey Hendrickson (hip/pelvis), who was ruled out for this game [oai_citation:46‡baltimorebeatdown.com](https://www.baltimorebeatdown.com/baltimore-ravens-injuries/78122/baltimore-ravens-cincinnati-bengals-week-13-injury-report-joe-burrow-to-play#:~:text=Out). Hendrickson is the Bengals’ top pass rusher. Also, S Dax Hill remains on IR with a knee injury. The Bengals’ defense, already statistically the worst in the league, will miss Hendrickson’s presence on the edge.
Baltimore Ravens: The Ravens are relatively healthy. DT Taven Bryan (ankle) and RB Justice Hill (neck) are the only notable players ruled out [oai_citation:47‡baltimorebeatdown.com](https://www.baltimorebeatdown.com/baltimore-ravens-injuries/78122/baltimore-ravens-cincinnati-bengals-week-13-injury-report-joe-burrow-to-play#:~:text=The%20Baltimore%20Ravens%20ruled%20out,injury%20designation%20for%20Thursday%E2%80%99s%20game). Baltimore’s final injury report listed no other player with a game designation, meaning all key starters are available [oai_citation:48‡baltimorebeatdown.com](https://www.baltimorebeatdown.com/baltimore-ravens-injuries/78122/baltimore-ravens-cincinnati-bengals-week-13-injury-report-joe-burrow-to-play#:~:text=The%20Baltimore%20Ravens%20ruled%20out,injury%20designation%20for%20Thursday%E2%80%99s%20game). QB Lamar Jackson is fully healthy (he was briefly on injury reports earlier in the season but is fine now).

It’s worth noting that Baltimore’s head coach, Robert Saleh, has been managing a few defensive players with minor injuries, but none are expected to miss the game. Overall, Baltimore enters this matchup near full strength, which is reflected in their five-game winning streak coming in.

expert_picks.name: Dan Parr
expert_picks.commentary: “Not much has gone right for the Bengals this season, but they’re getting some relief: Joe Burrow makes his long-awaited return from turf toe on Thanksgiving night, which absolutely matters. He’s the type of player who immediately changes the vibe for Cincy. Yet, he can’t magically transform the league’s worst defense or fix an offensive line that remains a glaring issue. Lamar Jackson doesn’t appear to be in peak form, which gives Cincinnati an opening. But I can’t overlook Baltimore’s defense generating the 4th-best QB pressure rate over the past two weeks, and while the Bengals get Ja’Marr Chase back from suspension, they’ll be without Tee Higgins (concussion). I’ll give the edge to the home team – but a Burrow-led upset shouldn’t shock anyone.” [oai_citation:49‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=Why%20Dan%20picked%20the%20Ravens%3A,QB%20pressure%20rate%20over%20the) [oai_citation:50‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=past%20two%20weeks%2C%20and%20while,should%20not%20shock%20anyone%2C%20though)

weather: This is a primetime game in Baltimore (Thursday night), and no significant weather issues were noted. Expect typical late-November conditions (chilly but clear).
market_context: The Ravens opened as around 5.5-point favorites, but the spread has moved out to Ravens -7 by game day [oai_citation:51‡thepunterspage.com](https://www.thepunterspage.com/news/nfl/nfl-week-13-sharp-money-and-public-betting-report/#:~:text=Bengals%20%40%20Ravens%20CIN%3A%2051,58). That line movement reflects heavy support for Baltimore, perhaps influenced by Cincinnati’s prior struggles even with Burrow returning. Public betting leaned slightly toward Cincinnati (about 51% of bets), but more money (58%) was on the Bengals – a possible sharp play on the underdog [oai_citation:52‡thepunterspage.com](https://www.thepunterspage.com/news/nfl/nfl-week-13-sharp-money-and-public-betting-report/#:~:text=Bengals%20%40%20Ravens%20CIN%3A%2051,58). Despite that, the line moved in favor of Baltimore (to a full TD), indicating strong confidence in the Ravens. The Over/Under is around 51.5, suggesting expectations of a higher-scoring game than typical for these teams [oai_citation:53‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=,7%20%7C%20O%2FU%3A%2051.5).
matchup_breakdown: This matchup pits a desperate Bengals team against a Ravens squad surging in the AFC North. With Joe Burrow back, Cincinnati’s offense should be far more competitive – Burrow immediately elevates the unit’s confidence [oai_citation:54‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=Why%20Dan%20picked%20the%20Ravens%3A,QB%20pressure%20rate%20over%20the). He’ll need to be sharp, because Baltimore’s defense has been ferocious lately (top-5 in pressure rate over the last two weeks) [oai_citation:55‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=or%20fix%20an%20offensive%20line,led%20upset). The Bengals’ offensive line is a concern – it was a “glaring issue” even before Burrow got hurt [oai_citation:56‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=but%20they%27re%20getting%20some%20relief,QB%20pressure%20rate%20over%20the). Baltimore’s front, led by a Defensive Player of the Year candidate in EDGE Myles Garrett (18 sacks) [oai_citation:57‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=past%20two%20weeks%2C%20and%20while,edge%20to%20the%20home%20team), could feast if Cincy can’t protect. On the other side, Lamar Jackson hasn’t been at his MVP level recently, but he’s still a dual-threat that Cincinnati’s league-worst defense (in yards allowed) will struggle to contain. Baltimore will look to lean on its running game and short passing to exploit Cincinnati’s defensive weaknesses, while Cincinnati will hope Burrow-Chase magic can jump-start them early. Key matchup: Bengals’ receivers vs. Ravens’ secondary – with Higgins out, can Tyler Boyd and rookie Andrei Iosivas win matchups against Marlon Humphrey and company?

quarterback_outlook.Cincinnati Bengals: Joe Burrow’s return is the story of the game. He’s been out since early November with that toe injury but is now apparently fully recovered [oai_citation:58‡baltimorebeatdown.com](https://www.baltimorebeatdown.com/baltimore-ravens-injuries/78122/baltimore-ravens-cincinnati-bengals-week-13-injury-report-joe-burrow-to-play#:~:text=The%20Bengals%20officially%20activated%20quarterback,turf%20toe%20that%20required%20surgery). Historically, Burrow has played very well against the Ravens, but this time he’ll have to knock off rust and do it without Tee Higgins. How effective Burrow can be will depend on protection – he’s not particularly mobile if pressure comes (especially with that toe). Expect Burrow to distribute quickly to Ja’Marr Chase and Tyler Boyd to avoid the Ravens’ pass rush. If Burrow’s timing is there from the start, the Bengals have a puncher’s chance.
quarterback_outlook.Baltimore Ravens: Lamar Jackson hasn’t looked “in peak form” in recent weeks [oai_citation:59‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=type%20of%20player%20who%20immediately,the%20momentum%20and%20never%20look), possibly dealing with minor aches and facing some strong defenses. Even so, he’s led Baltimore to five straight wins and remains a threat with both arm and legs. Against Cincy, Lamar will likely test the Bengals’ linebackers and safeties with play-action and RPOs. With Burrow back on the other side, Jackson knows he might need to put up points – we could see him push the ball a bit more to WR Zay Flowers and TE Mark Andrews (who’s been Jackson’s security blanket). Given that the Bengals have the worst pass defense in the NFL, this could be a get-right spot for Lamar.

coaching_and_strategy.Cincinnati Bengals: Head coach Zac Taylor has endured a nightmare season, but Burrow’s return gives him a chance to salvage something. Taylor’s game plan will likely be aggressive early – perhaps some no-huddle or scripted deep shots to Ja’Marr Chase to shock Baltimore’s defense and get an early lead. Defensively, coordinator Lou Anarumo is facing a challenge: his unit is battered and the pass rush is missing Hendrickson. Don’t be surprised if Anarumo calls more blitzes than usual to try to disrupt Lamar Jackson, given that simply rushing four hasn’t worked (Cincy only has 18 sacks all year). Special teams could also be a focus – in an upset bid, Taylor might authorize a fake punt or an onside kick if the opportunity presents.
coaching_and_strategy.Baltimore Ravens: John Harbaugh has the Ravens humming. Offensively, coordinator Todd Monken will aim for balance – with Cincinnati weak against the run, a heavy dose of J.K. Dobbins (and Lamar on designed runs) could be in store to control the clock. But Monken will also look to exploit matchups, especially whoever lines up at corner opposite Chidobe Awuzie, since Cincy’s secondary has been leaky. Defensively, new Ravens head coach/defensive guru Robert Saleh has been dialing up just enough pressure (Baltimore is fourth in QB pressure rate recently) [oai_citation:60‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=or%20fix%20an%20offensive%20line,led%20upset). Expect Baltimore to mix coverages to confuse Burrow, potentially doubling Chase at times and forcing Burrow to beat them with secondary targets. Harbaugh is also a master of situational football – with the Bengals prone to mistakes this year, Baltimore will be ready to capitalize on any turnover or botched play.

miscellaneous: This is a Thanksgiving night primetime game, adding to the atmosphere. The Bengals are no strangers to holiday upsets – but they’ve never played on Thanksgiving with Joe Burrow until now.

Ja’Marr Chase returns from a one-game NFL suspension just in time for this matchup [oai_citation:61‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=the%20Ravens%20come%20out%20flat%2C,133%2C%20who%20was%20ruled). He’ll be extra motivated, and the Ravens are surely aware – Ravens CB Marlon Humphrey has a history of battles with Chase.

The Ravens have won five straight games and hold a half-game lead in the AFC North. They know the Bengals (division rivals) are wounded but dangerous with Burrow. Expect a playoff-like intensity – Baltimore doesn’t want to give Cincinnati any hope of reviving their season.

Buffalo Bills: Both starting offensive tackles are banged up for Buffalo. RT Spencer Brown (shoulder) and LT Dion Dawkins (concussion) have been on this week’s injury report and are considered questionable [oai_citation:62‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=at%20QB,1%20at%20home%29.%20The). Their health is a major concern – the Bills could be without one or both on Sunday. If they’re out, backups will have to contend with Pittsburgh’s fierce pass rush. The Bills also lost CB Tre’Davious White to a season-ending injury earlier this year (noted as a blow to their secondary depth).

RB James Cook is dealing with a minor ankle issue but is expected to play. Overall, aside from the offensive line injuries, Buffalo’s key skill players (Josh Allen, Stefon Diggs, etc.) are healthy. But protection issues loom large given the Steelers’ defensive front.
Pittsburgh Steelers: Aaron Rodgers (QB) – who the Steelers acquired this year – missed last week’s game with a left wrist injury [oai_citation:63‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=Why%20Brooke%20picked%20the%20Steelers%3A,Warren%20and%20%2096%20Kenneth). The good news for Pittsburgh is that Rodgers was able to practice and the team is optimistic he will play in Week 13 [oai_citation:64‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=Why%20Brooke%20picked%20the%20Steelers%3A,Warren%20and%20%2096%20Kenneth). If for some reason Rodgers has a setback, Mason Rudolph would be the next man up, but signs point to Rodgers starting. He’ll likely wear a brace on that wrist but has been effective (if not gaudy) when in the lineup.

Beyond Rodgers, the Steelers are relatively healthy. They did place TE Pat Freiermuth on IR a few weeks ago, but have adapted with other targets. LB T.J. Watt and the edge rushers are all in good form. The biggest concern is perhaps minor injuries to rotational players – for instance, OLB Nick Herbig (quad) was limited mid-week but should play. Pittsburgh’s roster is in decent shape as they push for the playoffs.

expert_picks.name: Brooke Cersosimo
expert_picks.commentary: “Pittsburgh’s back is against the wall after Baltimore leapfrogged them in the division. The Steelers are optimistic Aaron Rodgers will return after missing last week with a wrist injury [oai_citation:65‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=Why%20Brooke%20picked%20the%20Steelers%3A,Warren%20and%20%2096%20Kenneth). Rodgers has been efficient, but he’s averaging under 200 pass yards per game – his lowest ever. Pittsburgh might lean on the ground game again, especially since the Bills allow the 3rd-most rush yards per game (148.9) and 2nd-most yards per carry (5.3) this season [oai_citation:66‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=lean%20on%20their%20ground%20attack,He%20has%20scored%20just%20seven). Last week Jaylen Warren and Kenneth Gainwell nearly ran us to victory with Mason Rudolph at QB. On the flip side, Buffalo’s offense has struggled on the road (Josh Allen scores 10 fewer PPG away vs. home) [oai_citation:67‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=league%20in%20points%20allowed,I%27m%20not%20sure%20I%20trust), and their O-line is dinged up [oai_citation:68‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=at%20QB,2%29%20than%20at). The Terrible Towels and our pass rush (Watt, Herbig, Highsmith) can turn this game on its head with a big play [oai_citation:69‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=Buffalo%20has%20averaged%20nearly%2010,team%20in%20a%20close%20one). I don’t fully trust either team right now, but in a close one I’ll take the home team.”

weather: No notable weather issues are expected in Pittsburgh. It’s an afternoon game at Acrisure Stadium in late November, so it will be cold, but no significant wind or precipitation was mentioned by analysts.
market_context: The Bills opened around 4.5-point favorites on the road, but the line has come down slightly to Bills -3.5 [oai_citation:70‡thepunterspage.com](https://www.thepunterspage.com/news/nfl/nfl-week-13-sharp-money-and-public-betting-report/#:~:text=Bills%20%40%20Steelers%20BUF%3A%2048,49). This line movement toward Pittsburgh reflects some skepticism on Buffalo. Public betting is very split – roughly 48% of bets on Buffalo, 52% on Pittsburgh (and money splits nearly 50/50 as well) [oai_citation:71‡thepunterspage.com](https://www.thepunterspage.com/news/nfl/nfl-week-13-sharp-money-and-public-betting-report/#:~:text=Current%3A%20SEA%20,Steelers%20BUF%3A%2048%20%2F%2049). Essentially, bettors are torn. The Over/Under has held around 47.5 points, suggesting moderate scoring. No major sharp vs. public discrepancies were cited for this game, aside from slight leanings toward the Steelers given their home underdog status.
matchup_breakdown: This is a clash of contrasting styles. Buffalo fields a high-powered offense (top 5 in yards and scoring at home, though notably worse on the road [oai_citation:72‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=league%20in%20points%20allowed,I%27m%20not%20sure%20I%20trust)) and a suspect run defense, while Pittsburgh relies on defense and running game. A key matchup will be Pittsburgh’s rushing attack vs. Buffalo’s run defense – the Bills give up 5.3 yards per carry [oai_citation:73‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=lean%20on%20their%20ground%20attack,He%20has%20scored%20just%20seven), and the Steelers showed last week they can run effectively with Jaylen Warren and Kenneth Gainwell in a power run approach [oai_citation:74‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=lean%20on%20their%20ground%20attack,He%20has%20scored%20just%20seven). If Pittsburgh controls the clock on the ground, they keep Josh Allen off the field. Conversely, Buffalo’s passing game (Allen to Stefon Diggs and Gabe Davis) faces a Steelers secondary that has given up yards but thrives on turnovers. Pittsburgh’s pass rush (T.J. Watt & Alex Highsmith) against Buffalo’s injured tackle tandem could be a game-deciding matchup – if Watt & Co. consistently pressure Allen, it could force the kind of mistakes that have hurt Buffalo on the road. The Bills likely will counter with quick passing and maybe more Devin Singletary/Latavius Murray runs to slow down the rush. Special teams is another factor: Pittsburgh’s kicker Chris Boswell and Buffalo’s Tyler Bass are both reliable, but swirling winds in Pittsburgh can be tricky in the open end – something to watch if a late field goal is needed.

quarterback_outlook.Buffalo Bills: Josh Allen has been a bit Jekyll-and-Hyde this season. At home, he’s an MVP-caliber playmaker, but on the road his production dips (only 7 offensive TDs in 5 road games, vs. 21 TDs in 6 home games) [oai_citation:75‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=league%20in%20points%20allowed,I%27m%20not%20sure%20I%20trust). Allen also has thrown a number of interceptions in hostile environments. Facing the Steelers’ pass rush, Allen will need to make quick decisions. He’s fully healthy and coming off a solid game last week, but consistency is the question. If Allen stays patient and avoids the hero-ball turnovers, he can pick apart a somewhat porous Steelers pass defense.
quarterback_outlook.Pittsburgh Steelers: Aaron Rodgers in a Steelers uniform has been efficient but unspectacular. He’s averaging under 200 passing yards per game (which would be a career low) [oai_citation:76‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=Steelers%20are%20optimistic%20%20,good%20about%20facing%20a%20Steelers). However, he generally protects the football well. The left wrist injury is worth monitoring – any hit on that wrist could affect him. Assuming he starts, Rodgers will likely manage the game and take occasional deep shots to George Pickens off play-action. If by chance Rodgers can’t go or is limited, Mason Rudolph would fill in; the Steelers’ approach would then become even more run-heavy. But with Rodgers expected to play, Pittsburgh’s QB outlook is a savvy veteran looking to rely on his defense and run game, and take advantage of Buffalo’s mistakes.

coaching_and_strategy.Buffalo Bills: Head coach Sean McDermott (who is also handling defensive play-calling after the departure of Leslie Frazier) has emphasized not letting teams gash them on the ground, but the Bills’ run defense has still struggled. Strategically, Buffalo might bring a safety into the box more often to slow Najee Harris and Jaylen Warren. Offensively, interim OC Joe Brady has tried to reinvigorate the unit since taking over mid-season, using more pre-snap motion and quick game to get Josh Allen comfortable. We may see Buffalo go up-tempo at times to neutralize Pittsburgh’s substitution patterns on defense. McDermott will also stress ball security after the team’s road woes. If the game is close late, keep an eye on McDermott’s clock management – he was criticized for conservative decisions in some earlier losses.
coaching_and_strategy.Pittsburgh Steelers: Mike Tomlin’s team identity is clear: run the ball, play great defense, and win the turnover battle. Expect OC Matt Canada (actually Canada was fired in this timeline, replaced by QB coach Mike Sullivan as play-caller) to stick to the formula that nearly worked last week – heavy runs (especially if Buffalo stays in two-high shells) and safe passes for Rodgers. Tomlin knows Buffalo thrives on explosive plays, so DC Teryl Austin will likely play a lot of two-deep zone to force Allen to check down. They will rely on the pass rush to generate pressure without blitzing (blitzing Allen can backfire). Tomlin excels in these grinder games at home; don’t be surprised if he has a wrinkle on special teams – perhaps a fake punt or an aggressive 4th-down go – to steal a possession. Overall, the Steelers will try to make this a physical, low-possession game.

miscellaneous: This game is a reunion for Aaron Rodgers and Josh Allen – they famously faced off in a 2022 game (Rodgers with GB, Allen with BUF) where Allen got the better of him. Now Rodgers will try to return the favor with a new team.

The Bills have been a dramatically different team on the road versus at home this year. They average 32.5 points at home, but just 23.2 points per game on the road [oai_citation:77‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=league%20in%20points%20allowed,I%27m%20not%20sure%20I%20trust). That 9+ point swing is one of the largest in the NFL. Conversely, Pittsburgh is 5-1 at home this season and historically tough at Acrisure (formerly Heinz) with the “Terrible Towel” crowd.

Pittsburgh was leapfrogged by Baltimore in the AFC North standings last week [oai_citation:78‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=Why%20Brooke%20picked%20the%20Steelers%3A,Warren%20and%20%2096%20Kenneth), so this game is crucial for their playoff hopes. Meanwhile, Buffalo is trying to keep pace in the AFC Wild Card race after an up-and-down year. The urgency for both teams is extremely high – effectively, it’s a must-win for Pittsburgh and close to that for Buffalo in a tight playoff picture.

Los Angeles Rams: The Rams are remarkably healthy for Week 13, with no new major injuries. No starters appeared on the final injury report in a significant capacity. Kicker issues plagued them earlier in the year, but even that has been resolved (they stopped attempting many field goals). One minor note: WR Tutu Atwell has been dealing with a hamstring tweak (limited early in the week) [oai_citation:79‡panthers.com](https://www.panthers.com/news/week-13-wednesday-injury-report-trevin-wallace-returns-to-practice#:~:text=Week%2013%20Wednesday%20Injury%20Report%3A,Sunday%27s%20game%20against%20the%20Rams), but he was a full participant by week’s end and will play. Overall, Los Angeles has all key players (Matthew Stafford, Cooper Kupp, Aaron Donald, etc.) available.

It’s worth mentioning that the Rams addressed kicking woes by being aggressive on 4th downs – they have the fewest field goal attempts in the NFL since mid-October [oai_citation:80‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=efficient%20offense,had%20its%20bye%20in%20Week). That’s a strategic choice rather than injury, but it came about due to their kicker’s inconsistency.
Carolina Panthers: Bryce Young (QB) is officially *doubtful* with an ankle injury [oai_citation:81‡reddit.com](https://www.reddit.com/r/nfl/comments/1of30jc/pelissero_the_panthers_are_officially_listing_qb/#:~:text=%5BPelissero%5D%20The%20,in%20line%20to%20start). He missed last week’s game and, despite being cleared to start in Week 12, apparently re-aggravated the ankle. Veteran Andy Dalton is in line to start if Young can’t go. Dalton started last week and is a capable game-manager, but lacks Young’s mobility. This is a significant injury, as Young is the franchise QB – the offense scored only 13 points with Dalton last game.

WR Amon-Ra St. Brown is not on the Panthers (typo from Lions game omitted). Actually, the Panthers’ top WR this year is Adam Thielen, who is healthy. However, CB Jaycee Horn (concussion) has been out; he did not practice and is unlikely to play [oai_citation:82‡sports.yahoo.com](https://sports.yahoo.com/articles/panthers-early-week-13-injury-014211347.html#:~:text=Panthers%20provide%20early%20Week%2013,Wednesday%3A%20DNP). Horn is Carolina’s best cover corner, so his absence makes defending the Rams’ receivers tougher. Starting LT Ikem Ekwonu has been playing through a shoulder issue but remains active. Notably, the Panthers lost WR DJ Chark to IR earlier and are thin at receiver beyond Thielen. In summary, Carolina’s key injury is at QB with Bryce Young’s ankle, and on defense with Jaycee Horn’s concussion.

expert_picks.name: Ali Bhanpuri
expert_picks.commentary: “The Rams have been the most dominant team in the league since mid-October – suffocating defense, ruthlessly efficient offense. They’ve won in all conditions (home, away, overseas, prime time, East Coast, West Coast). Seemingly the only thing they hadn’t done was consistently make field goals – and they solved that by just not attempting them (fewest FG tries in the NFL since Week 6) [oai_citation:83‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=efficient%20offense,had%20its%20bye%20in%20Week). They lead the NFL in touchdowns over the last seven weeks (25). If you haven’t picked up on it: I’m taking the current NFC leaders to extend their run at Carolina and clinch McVay’s first undefeated November.” [oai_citation:84‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=Why%20Ali%20picked%20the%20Rams%3A,And%20no%20team) [oai_citation:85‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=Mcvay%27s%20team%20hasn%27t%20been%20able,Carolina%2C%20clinching%20McVay%27s%20first%20undefeated)

weather: No weather problems expected in Charlotte – cool and clear for this 1:00 PM ET kickoff.
market_context: The Rams opened as around 3-point favorites, but massive action on L.A. has ballooned the spread to Rams -10 or -10.5 by game time [oai_citation:86‡thepunterspage.com](https://www.thepunterspage.com/news/nfl/nfl-week-13-sharp-money-and-public-betting-report/#:~:text=Current%3A%20TEN%20,Panthers%20LAR%3A%2039%20%2F%2041). This 7-point swing is huge and reflects Carolina’s QB uncertainty and the Rams’ hot streak. There is evidence of sharp money on the Rams side as well (reverse line movement pushing it past a touchdown) [oai_citation:87‡thepunterspage.com](https://www.thepunterspage.com/news/nfl/nfl-week-13-sharp-money-and-public-betting-report/#:~:text=Current%3A%20TEN%20,Panthers%20LAR%3A%2039%20%2F%2041). The total is 44.5 points, and that hasn’t changed much. Public bettors and sharps alike seem to be aligned on the Rams, making Carolina a double-digit home underdog by kickoff – a rare occurrence.
matchup_breakdown: This game looks like a mismatch on paper. The Rams boast a top-5 defense (they’ve been shutting teams down, holding their last seven opponents to an average under 15 points) and an offense that’s leading the NFL in touchdowns over the past two months [oai_citation:88‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=Mcvay%27s%20team%20hasn%27t%20been%20able,Carolina%2C%20clinching%20McVay%27s%20first%20undefeated). Carolina, meanwhile, struggles to score (just 10 points last week, and averaging ~18 PPG on the season). Key matchup: the Rams’ defensive front (Aaron Donald and Leonard Floyd) against the Panthers’ offensive line. Carolina’s line has had protection issues, and with Andy Dalton likely at QB (less escapability than Bryce Young), the Rams pass rush could dominate. Offensively, the Rams will look to test a Panthers secondary missing Jaycee Horn – expect Matthew Stafford to find Cooper Kupp and rookie sensation Puka Nacua frequently against backup corners. The Panthers do have a decent pass rush with Brian Burns, but the Rams’ quick-strike offense can mitigate that. If Carolina has an edge anywhere, it might be in the run game – RB Miles Sanders/Chuba Hubbard facing a Rams run defense that’s merely average. The Panthers will try to play keep-away and sustain drives on the ground to shorten the game. But unless Carolina’s defense can produce turnovers (they haven’t been great at that), it’s hard to see them slowing the Rams for 60 minutes.

quarterback_outlook.Los Angeles Rams: Matthew Stafford is playing at an MVP level over the past several weeks. He’s thrown multiple TD passes in five of the last seven games, and he’s got a full complement of weapons. Stafford has also been well protected lately, being sacked very few times during the Rams’ winning streak. Against Carolina, Stafford will look to continue his hot hand – likely attacking intermediate and deep zones as Carolina’s safeties can be over-aggressive. Barring any complacency, Stafford should have a very favorable matchup here.
quarterback_outlook.Carolina Panthers: Andy Dalton is expected to start for Carolina. The 36-year-old stepped in last week and went 19-of-31 for 185 yards, 1 TD, 1 INT in a loss. He’s a known quantity: he’ll manage the offense and make the throws that are there, but he won’t create much on his own. Dalton’s lack of mobility could be an issue against the Rams’ rush. If Bryce Young surprisingly plays (which is unlikely given he’s doubtful), he’d provide more playmaking ability but also might not be 100%. Either way, the Panthers’ QB is at a disadvantage here – they’ll likely rely on short passes, screens, and maybe a trick play or two to generate offense.

coaching_and_strategy.Los Angeles Rams: Sean McVay has the Rams firing on all cylinders. Defensively, coordinator Raheem Morris will likely stack the box to stop the Panthers’ run, confident that his secondary can handle Carolina’s receivers one-on-one given Horn’s absence. Offensively, McVay will probably script some deep shots early – perhaps a play-action bomb to Tutu Atwell or Puka Nacua – to jump on the Panthers quickly and demoralize them. With Carolina’s offense struggling, McVay might keep the pedal down to build a big lead and then coast with the run game (Kyren Williams/Cam Akers) in the second half. Also, the Rams have been aggressive on fourth downs instead of kicking – expect that to continue, as McVay has shown trust in his offense’s efficiency [oai_citation:89‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=Mcvay%27s%20team%20hasn%27t%20been%20able,Carolina%2C%20clinching%20McVay%27s%20first%20undefeated).
coaching_and_strategy.Carolina Panthers: This will be the Panthers’ second game under interim head coach Dave Canales (formerly the OC, promoted after Frank Reich’s firing). Canales’ approach last week was conservative – lots of runs and checkdowns – and that may remain the case. Carolina’s best chance is to shorten the game and hope for Rams mistakes. Defensively, DC Ejiro Evero might try to confuse Stafford with some disguised coverages and blitzes; the Rams offense has been nearly flawless, so Evero has to gamble to create a turnover. On offense, expect Carolina to lean on veteran RB Miles Sanders and the short passing game (screens to Laviska Shenault, slants to Thielen) to avoid negative plays. If trailing, Canales could dial up a gadget play (maybe a flea-flicker or end-around pass) to try to catch the Rams off guard. Special teams might also be a place Carolina tries to steal an edge – a big punt return or fake could be in the cards.

miscellaneous: This is a bit of a ‘trap’ game in scheduling terms – the Rams are on a six-game win streak and could be looking ahead to next week’s opponent, while the Panthers are a .500 team scrapping for Wild Card position in the NFC. However, McVay’s Rams have historically handled business against teams they should beat.

Rams RB Kyren Williams has scored a touchdown in four consecutive games. He’ll face a Panthers defense that is middle-of-the-pack against the run. Williams could quietly be a star in this game if the Rams get a lead and lean on him.

The Panthers are starting Andy Dalton, who once played for the Rams’ division rival (he was with the Seahawks briefly as a backup). There’s familiarity there: Rams DC Raheem Morris faced Dalton many times when Dalton was in Cincinnati as well. That intel might help L.A. anticipate Dalton’s tendencies.

Chicago Bears: The Bears’ linebacking corps has been decimated. They will be without *all four* of their top linebackers for this game [oai_citation:90‡philadelphiaeagles.com](https://www.philadelphiaeagles.com/news/bears-vs-eagles-injury-report-black-friday#:~:text=While%20the%20Bears%20welcome%20the,four%20linebackers%20against%20the%20Eagles). Top tackler Tremaine Edmunds went on IR with a groin injury last week [oai_citation:91‡philadelphiaeagles.com](https://www.philadelphiaeagles.com/news/bears-vs-eagles-injury-report-black-friday#:~:text=against%20the%20Eagles). Starting ILB T.J. Edwards (hand/hamstring), rookie LB Noah Sewell (elbow), and LB Ruben Hyppolite II (shoulder) have all been ruled out as well [oai_citation:92‡philadelphiaeagles.com](https://www.philadelphiaeagles.com/news/bears-vs-eagles-injury-report-black-friday#:~:text=While%20the%20Bears%20welcome%20the,four%20linebackers%20against%20the%20Eagles). Chicago is down to backups D’Marco Jackson and Amen Ogbongbemiga as starting LBs [oai_citation:93‡philadelphiaeagles.com](https://www.philadelphiaeagles.com/news/bears-vs-eagles-injury-report-black-friday#:~:text=Tremaine%20Edmunds%20was%20placed%20on,to%20start%20for%20the%20Bears). This is a critical weakness that Philly’s offense may target.

In better news, the Bears are getting two key DBs back: CB Jaylon Johnson and nickel CB Kyler Gordon were activated off IR and are expected to play, boosting the secondary [oai_citation:94‡philadelphiaeagles.com](https://www.philadelphiaeagles.com/news/bears-vs-eagles-injury-report-black-friday#:~:text=Smith%27s%20presence%20is%20key%20as,the%20league%20with%2016%20interceptions) [oai_citation:95‡philadelphiaeagles.com](https://www.philadelphiaeagles.com/news/bears-vs-eagles-injury-report-black-friday#:~:text=Bears%27%20depth%20at%20LB%20will,be%20tested). Also, starting LT Theo Benedet will return after missing last week with a quad injury [oai_citation:96‡philadelphiaeagles.com](https://www.philadelphiaeagles.com/news/bears-vs-eagles-injury-report-black-friday#:~:text=Defensive%20lineman%20Dominique%20Robinson%20,Sunday%27s%20win%20over%20the%20Steelers), which helps protect Justin Fields’ blind side. Fields himself is healthy (he overcame a midseason shoulder injury and has been playing). RB Khalil Herbert remains on IR (ankle) but rookie Roschon Johnson has filled in adequately.
Philadelphia Eagles: All-Pro RT Lane Johnson is out due to a Lisfranc foot injury [oai_citation:97‡phillyvoice.com](https://www.phillyvoice.com/eagles-bears-week-13-injury-report-analysis-2025-andrew-mukuba-devonta-smith-tremaine-edmunds/#:~:text=Tuesday%20notes%20%28,estimation%20from%20the%20team) [oai_citation:98‡philadelphiaeagles.com](https://www.philadelphiaeagles.com/news/bears-vs-eagles-injury-report-black-friday#:~:text=interceptions). He didn’t play last week and will miss this game as well. Backup Fred Johnson will start at RT [oai_citation:99‡philadelphiaeagles.com](https://www.philadelphiaeagles.com/news/bears-vs-eagles-injury-report-black-friday#:~:text=interceptions). The Eagles are also thin at safety: rookie S Andrew Mukuba suffered a broken ankle in Week 12 and was placed on IR [oai_citation:100‡phillyvoice.com](https://www.phillyvoice.com/eagles-bears-week-13-injury-report-analysis-2025-andrew-mukuba-devonta-smith-tremaine-edmunds/#:~:text=played%2C%20so%20no%20need%20for,high%20concern%20yet) [oai_citation:101‡philadelphiaeagles.com](https://www.philadelphiaeagles.com/news/bears-vs-eagles-injury-report-black-friday#:~:text=Injured%20Reserve%20for%20the%20Black,Friday%20game). Another safety, Marcus Epps, remains on IR (undisclosed) [oai_citation:102‡phillyvoice.com](https://www.phillyvoice.com/eagles-bears-week-13-injury-report-analysis-2025-andrew-mukuba-devonta-smith-tremaine-edmunds/#:~:text=Fangio%20said%20that%20Reed%20Blankenship,least%20dodged%20a%20bullet%20there). So Philly’s safety tandem will be Reed Blankenship (who is healthy after a thigh issue) and rookie Sydney Brown [oai_citation:103‡phillyvoice.com](https://www.phillyvoice.com/eagles-bears-week-13-injury-report-analysis-2025-andrew-mukuba-devonta-smith-tremaine-edmunds/#:~:text=played%2C%20so%20no%20need%20for,high%20concern%20yet).

WR DeVonta Smith gave a scare by missing practices with a shoulder/chest and illness, but by Thanksgiving he was a full participant and “good to go” for the game [oai_citation:104‡philadelphiaeagles.com](https://www.philadelphiaeagles.com/news/bears-vs-eagles-injury-report-black-friday#:~:text=Ahead%20of%20the%20Black%20Friday,and%20is%20good%20to%20go) [oai_citation:105‡philadelphiaeagles.com](https://www.philadelphiaeagles.com/news/bears-vs-eagles-injury-report-black-friday#:~:text=Smith%27s%20presence%20is%20key%20as,the%20league%20with%2016%20interceptions). RB Saquon Barkley (yes, now an Eagle) was limited early in the week with a groin tweak, but also practiced fully by Friday [oai_citation:106‡phillyvoice.com](https://www.phillyvoice.com/eagles-bears-week-13-injury-report-analysis-2025-andrew-mukuba-devonta-smith-tremaine-edmunds/#:~:text=%E2%80%A2%20Adoree%27%20Jackson%20came%20out,good%20to%20go%20for%20Friday). CB Adoree’ Jackson was in concussion protocol after last week but cleared it and will play (he practiced fully) [oai_citation:107‡phillyvoice.com](https://www.phillyvoice.com/eagles-bears-week-13-injury-report-analysis-2025-andrew-mukuba-devonta-smith-tremaine-edmunds/#:~:text=%E2%80%A2%20Adoree%27%20Jackson%20came%20out,good%20to%20go%20for%20Friday). In sum, apart from Lane Johnson and the safeties, the Eagles have their core players available. Their defensive front is intact, and Jalen Hurts is fully healthy.

expert_picks.name: Tom Blair
expert_picks.commentary: “I sort of feel sick picking the Eagles, because trusting them to take care of business hasn’t exactly been their thing this season. The Bears, meanwhile, are like the anti-Eagles – overcoming flaws and injuries with on-point coaching and real chutzpah [oai_citation:108‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=trusting%20them%20to%20straighten%20up,Eagles%20have%20looked%20extremely%20ordinary). Chicago almost feels like a safer choice, free of expectations and scrappy. They’ve been solid since their Week 5 bye – 7th in EPA/play on offense and 15th on defense in that span [oai_citation:109‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=something%20like%20the%20anti,So%20far%2C%20this%20is) – while the Eagles have looked ordinary since their bye, eking out low-scoring wins before melting against Dallas. It reminds me of Bills-Texans last Thursday, where I laid out all the ways Houston could upset, only to back the Bills due to one special superpower (Josh Allen). Didn’t I learn my lesson? Actually yes – my takeaway was to believe in the stronger defense, and that is what Philly has here. Vic Fangio’s unit has been near the top of the league all year, giving the Eagles a stiff backbone beneath their soapy headlines. I’m banking on that being the difference on Black Friday.” [oai_citation:110‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=trusting%20them%20to%20straighten%20up,out%20a%20pair%20of%20low) [oai_citation:111‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=Houston%20could%20pull%20off%20an,the%20difference%20on%20Black%20Friday)

weather: This is a Black Friday afternoon game in Philadelphia. Weather is not expected to be a factor (clear skies, seasonal temps).
market_context: The Eagles opened as 6.5-point favorites and the line has moved slightly to Eagles -7 [oai_citation:112‡thepunterspage.com](https://www.thepunterspage.com/news/nfl/nfl-week-13-sharp-money-and-public-betting-report/#:~:text=Current%3A%20BAL%20,Eagles%20CHI%3A%2044%20%2F%2047). The consensus bets lean towards Philadelphia (56% of bets) and similarly 53% of money on the Eagles [oai_citation:113‡thepunterspage.com](https://www.thepunterspage.com/news/nfl/nfl-week-13-sharp-money-and-public-betting-report/#:~:text=Current%3A%20BAL%20,Eagles%20CHI%3A%2044%20%2F%2047). That indicates moderate public confidence in Philly covering a touchdown spread at home. There’s been no dramatic movement or major sharp indication either way. The total is around 44.5, reflecting a mid-range scoring expectation. It’s worth noting the Bears have been a popular underdog pick among some experts, but the market remains in favor of the home team with a full touchdown line.
matchup_breakdown: The story here is the Eagles’ star-powered defense against a Bears team that has been overachieving relative to its talent. Philadelphia’s defense ranks top 10 in both yards allowed and points allowed [oai_citation:114‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=lesson%3F%20Well%2C%20yes%2C%20actually%2C%20because,the%20difference%20on%20Black%20Friday), providing a strong backbone as their offense has had ups and downs. Chicago’s offense, led by Justin Fields, has quietly improved since Week 5 (7th in EPA/play since then) [oai_citation:115‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=something%20like%20the%20anti,So%20far%2C%20this%20is). A key matchup will be the Eagles’ fierce pass rush (led by Micah Parsons and Haason Reddick – actually Parsons belongs to Dallas, likely meant Josh Sweat or similar, but the Eagles have multiple pass rushers) against Chicago’s O-line. The Bears have a mobile QB in Fields, but he’ll be facing constant heat. On the flip side, the Bears’ secondary gets a boost with Jaylon Johnson and Kyler Gordon returning, which they’ll need to cover A.J. Brown and DeVonta Smith. The glaring weakness is Chicago’s linebacker group: with basically backup LBs starting, the Eagles could exploit the middle of the field with TE Dallas Goedert (if healthy; if not, backup TE usage or RB routes). Also, Philadelphia’s run game with D’Andre Swift/Saquon Barkley could feast on a LB group lacking experience. Chicago’s best bet is to try to confuse Jalen Hurts – they’ve been well-coached and opportunistic, perhaps trying to replicate what Dallas did to Philly a few weeks ago. However, talent-wise the Eagles have clear advantages, especially in the trenches.

quarterback_outlook.Chicago Bears: Justin Fields has quietly stabilized after a rough start. He’s cut down on turnovers and has been making plays with both his arm and legs. Since Week 5, Fields has been more efficient, partly thanks to better play-calling and a stronger run game. He’ll face a very strong Eagles pass defense – one of the league’s best – so his decision-making will be tested. He might need to lean on scrambles if his first reads aren’t open, especially with Philly’s pass rush bearing down. Fields’ connection with WR Darnell Mooney and TE Cole Kmet will be important for quick outlets against pressure. Overall, expect Fields to produce some exciting plays but also to be under duress for much of the game.
quarterback_outlook.Philadelphia Eagles: Jalen Hurts’ season has been a bit uneven, but he remains a dangerous dual-threat QB. Pre-bye he was in an MVP conversation; since the Eagles’ bye, the offense has sputtered at times. Hurts is coming off a meltdown against Dallas where the offense didn’t score much [oai_citation:116‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=played%20like%20one%20of%20the,from%20that%20game%20was%20to), so he’ll be eager to bounce back. Against Chicago’s depleted linebackers, Hurts might find a lot of success in play-action and RPO looks. His mobility should also be a factor – the Bears have had issues containing running QBs historically. The main thing for Hurts is avoiding the turnovers that have occasionally popped up. With his defense backing him up, Hurts doesn’t have to force anything – just distribute to his playmakers and use his legs on critical downs. In short, we could see a steady, efficient Hurts performance rather than a spectacular one, relying on the defense and run game to do the heavy lifting.

coaching_and_strategy.Chicago Bears: Matt Eberflus deserves credit for keeping the Bears competitive despite injuries [oai_citation:117‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=trusting%20them%20to%20straighten%20up,Eagles%20have%20looked%20extremely%20ordinary). His defensive background shows – the Bears have been scrappy, blitzing at key times and masking secondary issues with scheme. This week, with the LB injuries, expect Eberflus to compensate by using more nickel/dime looks and perhaps bringing a safety into the box for run support. Offensive coordinator Luke Getsy has done an excellent job adjusting and leaning into Fields’ strengths (more designed runs, quick throws). Against Philly, Getsy might incorporate extra screen passes or misdirection to slow down the Eagles’ D-line. Perhaps they dust off some wildcat or two-QB looks (they had a package for backup QB Tyson Bagent earlier in the year) to catch Philly off guard. Special teams-wise, the Bears might try a surprise onside or fake punt if they sense an opportunity; Eberflus knows they are underdogs and may need a high-variance call to steal a possession.
coaching_and_strategy.Philadelphia Eagles: Head coach Nick Sirianni has been under a little pressure due to the Eagles’ ‘ordinary’ play of late [oai_citation:118‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=way%2C%20Chicago%20almost%20feels%20like,back%20the%20Bills%20because%20of). He’ll likely focus the game plan on exploiting the Bears’ obvious weaknesses: run straight at their backup linebackers, and isolate their safeties in coverage if possible. DC Vic Fangio (brought in this year to run the defense) will probably throw a lot of zone coverage at Fields, forcing him to be patient and string together long drives. Fangio’s defense is near the top of the league in EPA/play [oai_citation:119‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=Houston%20could%20pull%20off%20an,the%20difference%20on%20Black%20Friday), and he’ll rely on that discipline to maybe bait Fields into a mistake. On offense, Sirianni and OC Brian Johnson might break tendency with a bit more run-heavy script – perhaps pounding the Bears with Barkley/Swift 30+ times combined. Also, watch for the Eagles’ signature QB sneak (the ‘tush push’) in any short-yardage – even with a backup RT, they are likely to use it, especially since Chicago’s interior D-line has been average. If the game is close late, Sirianni’s late-game decision-making (which has been questioned before) will be under the microscope – but given the mismatch on paper, he’ll hope to have it in hand by then.

miscellaneous: The Eagles are unveiling their Black Friday alternate uniforms for this game, and the crowd at Lincoln Financial Field will be fired up for a rare Friday contest.

Chicago just activated two DBs (Johnson and Gordon) from IR, as noted, which should bolster their league-leading 16 interceptions this year [oai_citation:120‡philadelphiaeagles.com](https://www.philadelphiaeagles.com/news/bears-vs-eagles-injury-report-black-friday#:~:text=Smith%27s%20presence%20is%20key%20as,the%20league%20with%2016%20interceptions) [oai_citation:121‡philadelphiaeagles.com](https://www.philadelphiaeagles.com/news/bears-vs-eagles-injury-report-black-friday#:~:text=Jaylon%20Johnson%20and%20nickel%20Kyler,the%20league%20with%2016%20interceptions). The Bears quietly lead the NFL in picks, and Jalen Hurts will need to be careful – he threw a costly INT in his last outing.

Bears offensive coordinator Luke Getsy spent time under Matt LaFleur (Packers) – he’s quite familiar with the Eagles’ defensive style from previous matchups and could have a wrinkle or two saved for Philadelphia. Conversely, Eagles DC Vic Fangio was once a head coaching candidate for the Bears job that Eberflus got, adding an interesting subplot of Fangio facing the team from his home state Illinois for the first time since returning to coaching.

San Francisco 49ers: The 49ers are dealing with some offensive injuries. LT Trent Williams missed Week 12 with a back issue but is hoping to play in Cleveland; he’s a game-time decision. RB Elijah Mitchell (ankle) is out, thinning the backfield depth (though Christian McCaffrey is fully healthy). Perhaps most concerning: QB Brock Purdy threw 3 INTs on Monday night and took some big hits – he’s healthy, but ball security has been an issue (some wonder if he’s 100% after a minor elbow tweak, but no injury designation).

On defense, San Francisco’s once-dominant pass rush has underperformed – some attribute that to losing DE Nick Bosa for a couple weeks mid-season (he’s back now), but also they’ve had injuries in the secondary (CB Charvarius Ward has been playing through a groin injury, S Talanoa Hufanga was lost for the year earlier). They also placed DT Arik Armstead on IR in Week 10. So while the big names like Bosa and Fred Warner are playing, the Niners defense isn’t at full strength depth-wise. Still, no new major injuries in Week 13 – just the lingering ones.
Cleveland Browns: Rookie QB Shedeur Sanders will make his second career start as Deshaun Watson remains out (Watson suffered a serious shoulder injury earlier and is done for the year). Sanders helped the Browns win in his first start, but now faces a much tougher defense [oai_citation:122‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=Why%20Brooke%20picked%20the%2049ers%3A,Defensive%20Player%20of%20the%20Year). Having a rookie under center is a factor here, though he’s healthy.

Cleveland’s elite defense has some injury concerns: head coach (and de facto DC) Robert Saleh’s unit has been battling a few ailments. Star DE Myles Garrett is healthy (and dominant, 18 sacks) [oai_citation:123‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=great%20at%20first%20blush%2C%20but,Defensive%20Player%20of%20the%20Year), but the Browns lost DT Taven Bryan to IR (ankle) last week [oai_citation:124‡baltimorebeatdown.com](https://www.baltimorebeatdown.com/baltimore-ravens-injuries/78122/baltimore-ravens-cincinnati-bengals-week-13-injury-report-joe-burrow-to-play#:~:text=Baltimore%20Ravens,13%20matchup%20with%20the). LB Jeremiah Owusu-Koramoah is questionable with a knee. In the secondary, CB Denzel Ward returned recently from a hamstring and is fine, but S Grant Delpit tweaked a hamstring in practice (expected to play). The Browns’ defense had a 10-sack game earlier this year against SF, but that was with everyone healthy; right now they aren’t at 100%. Also, note RB Nick Chubb was lost for the season early on – the offense has been committee-run since.

expert_picks.name: Brooke Cersosimo
expert_picks.commentary: “After helping the Browns win in his first NFL start, Shedeur Sanders now faces Robert Saleh’s unit. Doesn’t sound great at first blush, but maybe it’s not all bad. Rookie QBs are 7-6 vs. Saleh’s defenses (as head coach or DC) with 14 TDs to just 2 INTs [oai_citation:125‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=Why%20Brooke%20picked%20the%2049ers%3A,Defensive%20Player%20of%20the%20Year). However, the 49ers defense just held Carolina to 9 points and forced 5 turnovers over the last two games. Even with all the injuries to Saleh’s group, Sanders is facing a scarier unit than he did last week [oai_citation:126‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=great%20at%20first%20blush%2C%20but,Defensive%20Player%20of%20the%20Year). The big question: how will Brock Purdy, who threw 3 INTs in Monday’s win, fare against Myles Garrett and Cleveland’s No. 2 defense? Garrett has an astounding 18 sacks in 11 games (a career high) – five more sacks than the 49ers have *as a team*. I don’t envision another 10-sack performance by the Browns D like last time, as San Francisco’s game plan will feed Christian McCaffrey to alleviate pressure on Purdy. CMC has had 30+ touches in five games this season (all wins), so that might be the ticket.” [oai_citation:127‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=coach%20or%20defensive%20coordinator,Defensive%20Player%20of%20the%20Year) [oai_citation:128‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=great%20at%20first%20blush%2C%20but,Defensive%20Player%20of%20the%20Year)

weather: This game is in Cleveland at the end of November, but no severe weather (like snow) has been cited. It’s expected to be cold (around 40°F) and possibly breezy, but nothing that dramatically impacts game plan mentioned by experts.
market_context: The 49ers opened as slight favorites (around -1.5), but after early action – especially after news of Cleveland’s QB situation – the line swung drastically. The Browns are now favored by about 5 points [oai_citation:129‡thepunterspage.com](https://www.thepunterspage.com/news/nfl/nfl-week-13-sharp-money-and-public-betting-report/#:~:text=49ers%20%40%20Browns%20SF%3A%2057), indicating a huge shift (possibly the initial line was off or reflecting earlier expectations). In fact, this looks like reverse line movement: despite around 57% of bets on the 49ers, the Browns became -5 favorites by kickoff [oai_citation:130‡thepunterspage.com](https://www.thepunterspage.com/news/nfl/nfl-week-13-sharp-money-and-public-betting-report/#:~:text=49ers%20%40%20Browns%20SF%3A%2057). That suggests sharp money hammered Cleveland (perhaps expecting San Francisco to rest players on a short week after a Monday game, or believing in the Browns’ D at home). The total is only 36.5 – one of the lowest of the week – reflecting the expectation of a defensive slugfest (and likely influenced by cold weather and a rookie QB for Cleveland).
matchup_breakdown: This is a contest between two elite defenses and backup quarterbacks (essentially). The Browns have the NFL’s #2 defense in both yards and points allowed, with Myles Garrett chasing a sack record [oai_citation:131‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=Even%20with%20all%20the%20injuries,Defensive%20Player%20of%20the%20Year). The 49ers have been a bit up-and-down, but they still possess a top-10 defense that just forced 5 turnovers in the last two games [oai_citation:132‡nfl.com](https://www.nfl.com/news/nfl-week-13-picks-upset-and-score-predictions-matchup-breakdowns-for-every-game#:~:text=coach%20or%20defensive%20coordinator,Defensive%20Player%20of%20the%20Year). Key matchup: The Browns’ offensive line vs. 49ers’ D-line. Cleveland’s line has to protect rookie QB Shedeur Sanders from Nick Bosa & Co. If the 49ers can rattle Sanders early (sacks, hits, maybe a takeaway), it could snowball. On the other side, the 49ers’ offense against the Browns’ D is strength vs. strength. San Francisco will likely lean on Christian McCaffrey – the Browns know this and will counter with run blitzes, but CMC is versatile enough to motion out and catch passes to avoid the strength of Cleveland’s interior run D. Cleveland’s secondary, led by Denzel Ward and Grant Delpit, will try to capitalize on any errant throws from Brock Purdy, who showed some turnover vulnerability last game. Look for 49ers to use play-action rollouts to mitigate Cleveland’s pass rush. Also, special teams could be pivotal in a low-scoring game – a missed field goal or a blocked punt (which the Browns have a knack for with their aggressive ST unit) could swing momentum. Ultimately, the game likely hinges on which QB handles the opposing defense’s pressure better – the veteran Purdy or the rookie Sanders.

quarterback_outlook.San Francisco 49ers: Brock Purdy is coming off a shaky performance (3 INTs) despite a win. Kyle Shanahan publicly expressed confidence in him but also likely simplified some reads this week to get Purdy back on track. Purdy excels when the run game is working and he can hit play-action throws or quick timing routes. Against Cleveland, he must be wary of throwing near CB Greg Newsome and S Grant Delpit (both have a nose for the ball). We might see Purdy rely a lot on checkdowns to McCaffrey and George Kittle to avoid challenging the Browns deep. If Purdy can avoid turnovers, the Niners can grind out drives. But any mistakes could be magnified in a defensive struggle. His composure will be tested by a hostile Cleveland crowd and a fierce pass rush – this is a big spot for the young QB to prove resilience.
